column1: #Text=French workers use threats in compensation demand
#Text=Following similar threats by workers at New Fabris and Nortel , workers at JLG in Tonneins , France , threatened to blow up several platform cranes .
#Text=The JLG factory announced in April 2009 that it will fire 53 of its 163 workers by the end of 2009 , while the remaining 110 jobs will not be secure over the next 2 years .
#Text=JLG Tonneins was acquired in 2006 with its parent JLG Industries , a maker of aerial work platforms , by the U.S. -based Oshkosh Corporation .
#Text=Despite being hugely profitable in the past , production has been much reduced since 2008 with the contraction of the construction industry and lower demand for its products .
#Text=Despite excellent past results the new American management demanded sweeping cuts at the company .

#Text=In the view of locals , " the company 's actions are a disgrace given the expensive perks , such as official cars , for its corporate fat cats , compared to the sacrifice , silence , and dignity demanded by the company of those it has made redundant .
